alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 1:31PM CST until February 02 at 6:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Light snow remains, where some may see accumulations upwards to one inch of additional snow in the next couple hours. Otherwise, the snow is winding down and some blowing/drifting snow remains a threat. * WHERE...McDonough, Hancock and Putnam Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong north winds between 15-25 mph may cause blowing and drifting of snow, especially on east west roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 for Iowa, or by visiting 511ia.org, modot.org, or idot.Illinois.gov.
